github.copilot.chat.reviewSelection.inst.text: Verify TypeScript is used (not JavaScript) with explicit types where appropriate. Check for proper use of TypeScript strict mode features.
Ensure Svelte 5 runes syntax ($state, $derived, $effect) is used instead of legacy Svelte reactivity patterns.
Check stores follow the pattern: .svelte.ts files, IIFE wrapper, _state internal variable, data getter/setter, snake_case naming with _store suffix.
Verify no server-side runtime logic is used (this is a static site). Check that generic type parameters use descriptive PascalCase names.
Ensure Tailwind CSS classes are used properly and components are small and focused with good composition.

github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Write a single descriptive, dense sentence that summarizes all changes, using commas to enumerate multiple changes when necessary.
Be specific and technical, mentioning affected components, functions, or files directly in the sentence.
Keep the message under 100 characters when possible, but prioritize clarity over brevity.

github.copilot.chat.pullRequestDescripti.text: Always include a list of key changes in bullet points.
Reference any breaking changes or important migration notes.
Follow conventional commit format for the title: type(scope): description.
